Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3

Class POP3Connection

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connection
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.LineBasedConnection
        • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.pop3.POP3Connection
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ChannelHandler, AuthenticateState, ConnectedState, ListState, MailboxStatusState, MarkDeletedState, ResetState, RetrieveState, TopState, UidlState, UpdateState
    public class POP3Connection
extends LineBasedConnection
implements ConnectedState, AuthenticateState, MailboxStatusState, ListState, RetrieveState, MarkDeletedState, ResetState, TopState, UidlState, UpdateState
    Connection handler for the POP3 protocol. This manages one POP3 session over a TCP connection, handling command parsing, authentication, and message retrieval according to RFC 1939.

    POP3 Protocol States (RFC 1939 Section 3):

    • AUTHORIZATION - waiting for authentication (USER/PASS or APOP)
    • TRANSACTION - authenticated, can access mailbox
    • UPDATE - after QUIT, commit changes to mailbox
    Author:
    Chris Burdess

        protected POP3Connection​(POP3Server server,
                         javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine,
                         boolean secure)
        Creates a new POP3 connection.
        Parameters:
        server - the POP3 server that created this connection
        engine - the SSL engine if this is a secure connection, null for plaintext
        secure - true if this connection should use TLS encryption

        Called when TLS handshake completes. For POP3S, sends the initial greeting. For STLS, connection continues normally.
        Overrides:
        handshakeComplete in class Connection

      • acceptConnection

        public void acceptConnection​(java.lang.String greeting,
                             AuthorizationHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectedState
        Accepts the connection and sends a greeting banner.

        Sends a +OK response to the client with the specified greeting message and transitions to the AUTHORIZATION state where authentication commands are expected.

        The greeting message typically includes the server name. For example: 

         "POP3 server ready"
        Specified by:
        acceptConnection in interface ConnectedState
        Parameters:
        greeting - the greeting text to send (without the +OK prefix)
        handler - receives authentication events after Realm verification

      • acceptConnectionWithApop

        public void acceptConnectionWithApop​(java.lang.String greeting,
                                     java.lang.String timestamp,
                                     AuthorizationHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectedState
        Accepts the connection with APOP capability and sends a greeting banner.

        Sends a +OK response with an APOP timestamp included in the greeting, allowing clients to authenticate using APOP (RFC 1939 Section 7).

        The timestamp should be in the format: <process-id.clock@hostname>

        Specified by:
        acceptConnectionWithApop in interface ConnectedState
        Parameters:
        greeting - the greeting text (without the +OK prefix or timestamp)
        timestamp - the APOP timestamp (will be appended to the greeting)
        handler - receives authentication events after Realm verification

      • rejectConnection

        public void rejectConnection()
        Description copied from interface: ConnectedState
        Rejects the connection with a default message.

        Sends a -ERR response and closes the connection. ClientConnected.disconnected() will be called.

        Specified by:
        rejectConnection in interface ConnectedState

      • rejectConnection

        public void rejectConnection​(java.lang.String message)
        Description copied from interface: ConnectedState
        Rejects the connection with a custom message.

        Sends a -ERR response with the specified message and closes the connection. ClientConnected.disconnected() will be called.

        Specified by:
        rejectConnection in interface ConnectedState
        Parameters:
        message - the rejection message (without the -ERR prefix)

      • receive

        public void receive​(java.nio.ByteBuffer buf)

        Specified by:

        Parameters:

      • accept

        public void accept​(Mailbox mailbox,
                   TransactionHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: AuthenticateState
        Accepts the authenticated principal and opens the mailbox.

        Transitions to TRANSACTION state. The handler will receive subsequent commands via the TransactionHandler.

        Specified by:
        accept in interface AuthenticateState
        Parameters:
        mailbox - the user's opened mailbox
        handler - receives transaction state commands

      • reject

        public void reject​(java.lang.String message,
                   AuthorizationHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: AuthenticateState
        Rejects the authenticated principal.

        Even though the Realm authenticated the user, the handler is vetoing access (e.g., account disabled, access policy).

        Specified by:
        reject in interface AuthenticateState
        Parameters:
        message - the rejection message
        handler - continues receiving authorization commands

      • rejectAndClose

        public void rejectAndClose​(java.lang.String message)
        Description copied from interface: AuthenticateState
        Rejects and closes the connection.

        Use for severe policy violations where the client should not be allowed to retry.

        Specified by:
        rejectAndClose in interface AuthenticateState
        Parameters:
        message - the rejection message

      • sendStatus

        public void sendStatus​(int messageCount,
                       long totalSize,
                       TransactionHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: MailboxStatusState
        Sends mailbox statistics.

        Sends a +OK response with the message count and total size: +OK nn mm where nn is message count and mm is size in octets.

        Specified by:
        sendStatus in interface MailboxStatusState
        Parameters:
        messageCount - number of messages (excluding deleted)
        totalSize - total size of all messages in octets
        handler - continues receiving transaction commands

      • sendMessage

        public void sendMessage​(long size,
                        java.nio.channels.ReadableByteChannel content,
                        TransactionHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: RetrieveState
        Sends the message content.

        Sends a +OK response with the message size, then streams the message content from the channel with byte-stuffing, and terminates with a line containing only '.'.

        Specified by:
        sendMessage in interface RetrieveState
        Parameters:
        size - the message size in octets
        content - the message content channel
        handler - continues receiving transaction commands after send completes

      • commitAndClose

        public void commitAndClose()
        Description copied from interface: UpdateState
        Commits deletions and closes the connection successfully.

        Sends a +OK response indicating the session ended normally and all marked messages were deleted. ClientConnected.disconnected() will be called.

        Specified by:

      • close

        public void close()
        Description copied from class: Connection
        Closes the connection gracefully. For SSL connections, sends close_notify before closing. The actual close happens after netOut is flushed by SelectorLoop.
        Overrides:
        close in class Connection
